member.name: T:OpenRasta.Pipeline.Contributors.HttpMethodOverriderContributor
member.summary: Supports the use of the X-HTTP-Method-Override header to override the verb used by OpenRasta for processing.
member.remarks: Clients that can add http headers may not support other verbs than POST (Flash and Silverlight for example). With the X-HTTP-Method-Override header, OpenRasta will process the request as if it was made using a genuine http verb.

member.summary: Processing of the pipeline is complete.

member.summary: One object will be created every time it is requested in a constructor

member.summary: Only one of this type of object will ever be created and will last as long as the AppDomain.

member.name: F:OpenRasta.DI.DependencyLifetime.PerRequest
member.summary: One object will be created per request made to OpenRasta. It will be released at the end of the current request.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.MediaType
member.summary: Represents an internet media-type as defined by RFC 2046.

member.name: M:OpenRasta.Web.MediaType.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A , for example, "text/plain; charset=us-ascii", that contains the internet media type, subtype, and optional parameters.
member.exception: is in a form that cannot be parsed.

member.name: M:OpenRasta.Web.HttpOperationAttribute.Find(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Tries to find an HttpOperation attribute on a method.
member.returns: The instance of the HttpOperation attribute, or null if none were defined.

member.name: M:OpenRasta.Codecs.ICodecRepository.FindMediaTypeReader(OpenRasta.Web.MediaType,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenRasta.TypeSystem.IMember},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenRasta.TypeSystem.IMember})
member.summary: Selects the best codec for a given media type and a set of parameters to be resolved.
member.returns: The codec registration and score matching the list of parameters.

remarks.para: The score is calculated as the average distance of the codec to the parameter types.
For example, if Customer inherits directly from Object, the distance between Object and Customer is 1,and the distance between Customer and itself is 0.

member.summary: Represents a "201 Created" response.

member.summary: Represents a 302 Found response: the requested resource resides temporarily under a different URI.

member.summary: Represents a 300 Multiple representations response.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.OperationResult.NoContent
member.summary: Represents a "204 No content" response.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.OperationResult.OK
member.summary: Represents a "200 OK" response.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.OperationResult.RequestMediaTypeUnsupported
member.summary: The request media type (described by the Content-Type header in the request) could not be understood by the server. This will trigger a 415 error code.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.OperationResult.ResponseMediaTypeUnsupported
member.summary: The resource represented by the request could not be returned in any format the client declared supporting through the Accept header.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.OperationResult.SeeOther
member.summary: Represents a 303 See other response: the response to the request can be found under a different URI and SHOULD be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.

member.name: M:OpenRasta.Web.UriDecorators.IUriDecorator.Parse(System.Uri,System.Uri@)
member.summary: Parses a Uri.
member.param: The uri to process
The uri after processing
member.returns: true if work needs to be done after the Uri processing is done, resulting in a call to Apply(). Otherwise false.

member.name: M:OpenRasta.Web.UriDecorators.IUriDecorator.Apply
member.summary: Applies any changes after al the Uri decorators have been called.

member.name: T:OpenRasta.Web.UriDecorators.ContentTypeExtensionUriDecorator
member.summary: Decorates a uri with an extension, similar to a file system extension, to override content-type negotiation.
member.remarks: The extension is always processed at the end of the uri, and separated by a dot. The matching is done per-resource, based on the extension declared for the codec associated with a resource.
